greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest m such that sum of distinct primes dividing m equals n, or 0 if no such number exists (as at n=1,4,6).
comment: a(n) = first occurrence of n in A008472 (sum of prime factors of n without repetition).
Note that for all primes p, p = a(p); if n is composite then a(n) must be a composite and the only zeros are 1, 4 and 6.
link: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
mathematica: t = Table[0, {100} ]; Do[a = Apply[Plus, Transpose[ FactorInteger[n]] [[1]]]; If[ a < 101 && t[[a]] == 0, t[[a]] = n], {n, 2, 10^5} ]; Append[t, 0]
program: (PARI) sopf(n)= { local(f,s=0); f=factor(n); for(i=1, matsize(f)[1], s+=f[i, 1]); return(s) } { for (n=1, 1000, if (n==1 || n==4 || n==6, m=0, if (isprime(n), m=n, m=1; while(sopf(m) != n, m++))); write("b064502.txt", n, " ", m) ) } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Sep 16 2009
results.author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Oct 05 2001
